instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbusg3h 12.27v
threads.message: [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL] no water damaged. No green light, 12.27v on ppbusg3h, smc not turning on? Bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Thanks in advanced

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbusg3h 12.27v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbusg3h 12.27v
threads.message: 12.27V point to the SMC not running. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> voltage. I assume this is with no battery connected of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbusg3h 12.27v
threads.message: thanks for the reply. Customer took the board already. you can mark it as solved. Thanks.
